The NPE is actually coming from one of the active bundles in the Framework.  
According to the log it is the org.eclipse.core.runtime bundle that throws an 
NPE when stopped.  When the Framework is shutdown it stops all active 
bundles.  One of the active bundles is throwing an NPE when stopped.  
Unfortunately error message in the BundleException does not tell which bundle 
it is because there is a bug when creating the BundleException when the error 
occurs during Bundle.stop()

I have checked in a fix for the BundleException message so we can tell which 
bundle is causing the problem.  Note that the Framework did shutdown properly 
it just logged this Error (with a bad message) because one of the active 
bundles threw the exception while stopping.  The Framework will continue with 
the shutdown process even though one of the bundles threw an exception during 
shutdown.

Leaving this defect open because I suspect that the runtime bundle is throwing 
the NPE.  Need to reproduce the with the fixed error message to tell where the 
NPE is actually occurring.
Tom, Jared, did you had a chance to try to reproduce that?

I have tried but have not been able to reproduce.  It is impossible to tell 
where the NPE is comming from unless we reproduce on the latest builds where 
the error message should be fixed.  Jared, can you please try to reproduce this 
on M9 or later build?

I can't reproduce the problem either. Can't you just look in the CVS revision history to see what the 
code looked like?

Looking at the code from build 200405171219 will not help here because the log 
message is bogus.  The code that caught the NPE and logged it was not logging 
the error properly.  It gives us no useful information for telling where in the 
code a NPE happened.  So even if we looked at the old code we still would not 
know where to look.

Closing this as we cannot reproduce.  Please reopen if you see the problem 
again.
